'''Christopher Fairchild Edley, Jr.''' (born January 13, 1953)<ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=f20v23TpqUQC&q=%22Edley,+Christopher%22+AND+%221953%22&dq=%22Edley,+Christopher%22+AND+%221953%22&hl=en&ei=LgDGTdiXHYXd0QG9r7mKCA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=8&ved=0CEUQ6AEwBw Google Books]</ref> is [[Dean (education)|Dean]] of the [[University of California, Berkeley School of Law]] ([[Boalt Hall]]). After receiving his undergraduate degree from [[Swarthmore College]], he attended [[Harvard Law School]], where he later served as a professor. He is married to [[Maria Echaveste]], former deputy chief of staff for U.S. President [[Bill Clinton]].
He served as an advisor to President Clinton's [[One America Initiative]], was a member of the [[United States Commission on Civil Rights]], and chaired President Clinton's 1998 Affirmative Action Review. In the [[United States presidential election, 2008|2008 presidential election]], he supported and advised candidate [[Barack Obama]], one of his former students at Harvard Law School.<ref name=Slate>[[Emily Bazelon|Bazelon, Emily]] (2007-11-26) [http://www.slate.com/id/2177688/pagenum/all/ On the Advice of Counsel], ''[[Slate.com]]''</ref> On November 5, 2008, Edley was named to the advisory board of the [[Obama-Biden Transition Project]].<ref>Sweet, Lynn [http://blogs.suntimes.com/sweet/2008/11/jarrett_podesta_rouse_to_lead.html Jarrett, Podesta, Rouse to lead Obama transition; Bill Daley co-chair] ''Chicago Sun-Times'', November 5, 2008</ref>
According to legal journalist [[Emily Bazelon]], Edley "has written thoughtfully and moderately about [[affirmative action]]."<ref name=Slate/>
